p: Dyslipidemia and obesity have been gaining significant attention from public health officials in developing countries because they can result in an astonishing increase in the risk factors of diabetes, hepatic adipose infiltration, and cardiovascular disease. In view of the perceived role of food and nutrition in the etiology of chronic diseases and in their prevention, effective nutritional intervention strategies for preventing or managing chronic diseases would be desirable. In this context, it would be most appropriate to evaluate the nutraceutical potential of non-nutrient phytochemicals, especially phytochemicals with hypolipidemic and antioxidant properties.
